description: Strawberries are low-growing herbaceous plants belonging to the rose family. They produce white flowers and red, heart-shaped fruits known for their sweet flavor and characteristic aroma. The surface of the fruit is dotted with tiny seeds, each representing an individual achene.

flavor_profile.notes: Known for sweet flavor and characteristic aroma

season: Late spring to early summer (May-July in most regions)
storage_tips: Store unwashed in the refrigerator for up to 5 days. Spread in a single layer to prevent bruising. For longer storage, freeze whole berries on a baking sheet, then transfer to freezer bags. Frozen strawberries work well for jams.
preparation: Wash gently under cool water just before using. Remove the green hulls by pinching or using a paring knife. For jams, cut large berries in half to ensure even cooking and better texture. Small berries can be left whole for a chunkier jam.
